p: Representative brain MR images of a grafted patient are shown in Fig. 2. The sites and trajectory paths for cell implantation are shown in Figs. 2A and 2B, respectively. At the end of several needle tracks at 1, 2, and 4-year follow-ups small clusters of hypointensity on T2-weighted images were identified. At the annual MRI monitoring of P4, a robust graft outgrowth was observed in the right putamen ( Fig. 2C) with no topographic abnormalities of the brain structures. MRI with gadolinium and PET imaging with 3'-deoxy-3'-[ 18F]-fluorothymidine ( 18F-FLT) were performed and showed no evidence of tumor formation. Quantitative volumetric analysis was not performed at this time.
